headline.main: WHY IT MATTERS: Issues at Stake in Election
headline.print_headline: WHY IT MATTERS: Issues at Stake in Election

docs.snippet: Those who back the Democratic nominee seem overwhelmed by a wave of unease, exacerbated by Mrs. Clinton’s illness and a slow-footed acknowledgment of it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Those who back the Democratic nominee seem overwhelmed by a wave of unease, exacerbated by Mrs. Clinton’s illness and a slow-footed acknowledgment of it.
docs.abstract: Supporters of Hillary Clinton across country express their concerns, in polls and interviews, about possibility that Donald Trump may defeat Clinton.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton’s Backers Thought She Couldn’t Lose. Now, ‘I Can’t Go There.’
headline.print_headline: Once Certain of a Victory, Clinton’s Fans Fear Her Loss

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: In an example of what might be called the Khizr Khan effect, leaders of the Masjid Un-Noor mosque gave out small copies of the Constitution on Friday to remind congregants of their rights as Americans....
docs.lead_paragraph: In an example of what might be called the Khizr Khan effect, leaders of the Masjid Un-Noor mosque gave out small copies of the Constitution on Friday to remind congregants of their rights as Americans.

headline.main: A Staten Island Mosque Mixes Prayer and Patriotism
headline.print_headline: A Staten Island Mosque Mixes Prayer and Patriotism

docs.snippet: An interview with David Rothschild on prediction markets and how they point to the primacy of one race: the tipping-point state....
docs.lead_paragraph: An interview with David Rothschild on prediction markets and how they point to the primacy of one race: the tipping-point state.

headline.main: Why the Whole Trump-Clinton Election Could Probably Just Be Held in Pennsylvania

docs.snippet: After publicly backing away from his proposed tax cut for small businesses, Donald J. Trump’s campaign aides told a small-business group that he still supported the plan....
docs.lead_paragraph: After publicly backing away from his proposed tax cut for small businesses, Donald J. Trump’s campaign aides told a small-business group that he still supported the plan.
docs.abstract: Donald Trump's campaign staffers have told some groups his proposal for $1 trillion tax cut for small businesses is still in place, while telling others Trump has decided to eliminate it; conflicting accounts come even after Trump's advisers have taken months to refine details of his tax plan, although strategy of having two versions of his tax policy has redounded to his benefit.

headline.main: Conflicting Policy From Trump: To Keep, and Remove, Tax Cut
headline.print_headline: Is Trump’s Trillion-Dollar Tax Cut On or Off? It Depends on the Audience

docs.snippet: The survey found that women think that more progress has been made toward ending sexism than racism in society, but they perceive that men still hold advantages....
docs.lead_paragraph: The survey found that women think that more progress has been made toward ending sexism than racism in society, but they perceive that men still hold advantages.
docs.abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll examines women's political views and outlook on American life, finding 52 percent of them likely to vote will support Hillary Clinton, while 39 percent back Donald J Trump; many women praise Clinton, but do not see her candidacy as cure-all, and do not consider her role model.

headline.main: Poll Finds Most Voters Embrace Milestone for Women, if Not Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: Spot on Ballot Is No Cure-All, Women Say in Poll

byline.contributor: Dalia Sussman, Giovanni Russonello and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MARY JO MURPHY and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN

docs.snippet: Mrs. Obama made a rare appearance on the campaign trail on Friday to plead with young voters to support Hillary Clinton and extend President Obama’s legacy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Obama made a rare appearance on the campaign trail on Friday to plead with young voters to support Hillary Clinton and extend President Obama’s legacy.
docs.abstract: Michelle Obama, in speech at George Mason University in Virginia, urges young Americans to support Hillary Clinton's bid for presidency, making case that it would extend Pres Obama's legacy.

headline.main: Michelle Obama Makes Ardent Case for Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: First Lady Makes Ardent Case for Clinton

docs.snippet: A senior adviser to Democratic Republic of Congo President Joseph Kabila said on Friday he was on a "pleading mission" to Washington to press U.S. officials to support talks between the government and opposition on setting up new elections and not...
docs.lead_paragraph: A senior adviser to Democratic Republic of Congo President Joseph Kabila said on Friday he was on a "pleading mission" to Washington to press U.S. officials to support talks between the government and opposition on setting up new elections and not to impose sanctions that could hurt the process.

headline.main: Democratic Republic of Congo Adviser on 'Pleading Mission' to U.S. Not to Impose Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Democratic Republic of Congo Adviser on 'Pleading Mission' to U.S. Not to Impose Sanctions

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama said Saturday night he will take it as a "personal insult" if the African-American community fails to turn out for the presidential election and encouraged black voters to support Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said Saturday night he will take it as a "personal insult" if the African-American community fails to turn out for the presidential election and encouraged black voters to support Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Obama Urges African-American Voters to Protect His Legacy
headline.print_headline: Obama Urges African-American Voters to Protect His Legacy

docs.snippet: In a pair of university stops in battleground Ohio on Saturday, Bernie Sanders used his enduring popularity with young voters to urge support for Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. It's just that his crowds aren't what they used to be....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a pair of university stops in battleground Ohio on Saturday, Bernie Sanders used his enduring popularity with young voters to urge support for Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. It's just that his crowds aren't what they used to be.

headline.main: Sanders Urges Turned-Off Voters to Turn Out for Clinton
headline.print_headline: Sanders Urges Turned-Off Voters to Turn Out for Clinton
